page.title: 16Housing in South Elmsall
page.content: A{survey}of the Westfield Lane area showed that 37% of houses are terraced and 24% are semi_detached council houses,23% are privately owned homes and 16% are bungalows for the elderly. {Broadway}is a typical terrace built about 1905 when Frickley Colliery opened.The toilets used to be outside but most houses have been modernised and many are now privately owned.Beech St. is part of a large council estate of white,pebble_dash "semis"_hence the area's nickname,{"White City".}The hourly Castleford/Sth. Elmsall bus serves the estate and terminates here. {Vickers Ave.}with its privately owned houses,is smarter and more spacious, with the "posh" look about it. {Westfield Bungalows}is a small,quiet crescent devoted to homes for the elderly.Springfield corner shop is open all hours and sells everything.
